answers.answer: This could be scar tissue or some nerve involvement like you said. Often scar tissue will show up on film but you are evidently staying vigilant with your yearly Mammograms. I wonder if an Ultrasound might shed some addditional light on the subject.  Regards ..

question: I had a benign lumpectomy 2 years ago.  Periodically I feel chest pain, sort of like a knotting or cramping, have had EKG, enzyme tests following, fearing it was my heart, but those were negative.  I'm suspecting that perhaps there is some nerve involvement and with wearing different supporting bras, perhaps there is a pulling that is aggravating the incision area - ?   I can palpate areas around the incision that are sore to the touch, but do not totally mimic the pain I feel.  The pain increases with deep breathing.  It is not sharp.  I have family history of breast cancer, heart disease and diabetes.  I watch my blood sugar and it stays within normal limits.  Mammograms annually.
title: Post lumpectomy occasional chest pain
